page.title: 05Church-Interesting features
page.content: Interior - on the south wall is a piscina which is possibly from the 12th century. Another interesting feature is the remnant of the stairway to the rood screen loft, which is probably where the war memorial now stands. Without doubt, the most interesting object in the church is the font, which was probably made in the 12th century of Caen stone from Normandy. The font has iron staple marks on top where locks were used to stop holy water being stolen and used for black magic. There is a modern stained-glass window in memory of Sir Airey Neave, which has its own entry on Page 4. Exterior - the largest memorial in the churchyard is the Disney tomb, which contains eight members of the family that settled here from Lincolnshire in the 19th century.
